discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
check the docs!

The purpose of the Field attribute on a Breakdown Source form is:

D. Identifies the field that contains a unique value for every record for the breakdown source facts table

The Field attribute specifies which field within the chosen facts table will be used to categorize the data in the Breakdown Source. It should uniquely identify the elements of the breakdown.

choices.C: Limits the number of values returned by the Breakdown Source
choices.A: Defines the relationship between the corresponding Breakdown and Indicators
choices.D: Identifies the field that contains a unique value for every record for the breakdown source facts table
choices.B: Provides security for the Breakdown values based on user permissions

questions.question_text:
What is the purpose of the Field attribute on a Breakdown Source form?

//IMG//
Select the statements which correctly describe the respective Performance Analytics object behavior. (Choose two.)

choices.C: Breakdowns require a Breakdown Mapping to be added to an Automated Indicator
choices.D: Indicator Sources with a Monthly frequency can still be collected in a Daily job
choices.A: The frequency of an Indicator can differ from that of an Indicator Source
choices.B: Data collection must be completed before assigning Breakdowns to an Indicator

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
B and C are incorrect, tested in PDI

Selected Answer: CD
- A - annotation in Indicator source form "Indicator sources can only be selected in indicators if this setting matches the frequency of the indicator."
+C
+D

The statements which correctly describe the respective Performance Analytics object behavior are:

A. The frequency of an Indicator can differ from that of an Indicator Source - Indicators can be set to aggregate data at a different frequency than their source, for instance, collecting data daily but rolling it up into a weekly indicator.

D. Indicator Sources with a Monthly frequency can still be collected in a Daily job - While the frequency sets the default collection schedule, it's technically possible to collect data more frequently than the frequency setting would suggest, though this may not always be meaningful or necessary for the given Indicator.

questions.question_text: After importing an Update set from another instance, the Indicators, Breakdowns, and Jobs are imported correctly, but all of the Dashboards are completely empty. What is the most likely cause of this?

choices.A: The user does not have permissions to view the Dashboard.
choices.B: The Data Collection jobs have not finished running.
choices.D: “Unload Dashboard” was not performed before migrating the Update set.

discussion.content:
The most likely cause of the Dashboards being empty after importing an Update Set from another instance, assuming that the Indicators, Breakdowns, and Jobs are imported correctly, is:

D. “Unload Dashboard” was not performed before migrating the Update set.

When migrating components such as dashboards with Update Sets, it's crucial to perform an "Unload" operation, which prepares these components for the migration by including all necessary records in the Update Set. If this step is skipped, the dashboards may appear empty on the target instance because their definitions and associated widgets were not properly included in the Update Set.

questions.question_text: What calendar type can you use to analyse scores using time periods?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C- Custom is the option selected when you look at the calendar in Analytics hub score trends

To analyze scores using time periods, you can use a "Custom Business Calendar". This option allows for the analysis of scores based on specific business or operational calendars that might not align with standard calendar periods, providing flexibility for businesses to track performance against their unique operational timelines.

choices.B: Create a separate Indicator for each manager and apply additional conditions to the Indicator to only include incidents where they are the Assignment Group manager.
choices.C: Create a script that runs against the Breakdown, where the elements are filtered to show only the manager’s groups.
choices.D: Modify the “Average age open incidents” Indicator to add an additional condition that applies a dynamic filter, based on the logged in manager.
choices.A: Create a Breakdown relation between the Assignment Group Manager and the Assignment Group breakdowns.

questions.question_text:
You have the following configuration:
• Indicator Average age open incidents with two Breakdowns:
o Assignment Group Manager
o Assignment Group

You have this new requirement:
• When navigating the Average age open incidents Indicator and drilling into an Assignment Group Manager Breakdown element, the viewer should see the groups managed by the selected manager.

Which is the best way to achieve the desired result?

discussion.content:
The best way to achieve the desired result is:

A. Create a Breakdown relation between the Assignment Group Manager and the Assignment Group breakdowns.

Breakdown relations link two breakdowns together, allowing you to drill down from one breakdown into related elements of another. By establishing this relation, when a user drills into an Assignment Group Manager Breakdown element, the system can dynamically filter the subsequent view to show only those Assignment Groups that are related to the selected manager. This leverages existing functionality within Performance Analytics without the need for custom scripting or multiple indicators.
